title: Textile, ca. 1790
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 81.5 x 70 cm (32 1/16 x 27 9/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment
description: Straight repeat containing small landscape vignettes in which children play various games. The scenes are tied together by garlands of flowers. The games being played are: battledore, shuttlecock, kite flying, marbles, cards, playing of fife and drum, dart blowing, and a boy being pulled onto a wagon.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Medium: cotton
Technique: copperplate printed. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment. 1976-10-5.
